qa_data.question: When using Ctrl + L, I submit my prompt and I don't get a response, what should I do?
answer_steps: When you submit a prompt using Ctrl + L and don't get a response, it is likely a connection issue.
Here are some steps you can take.
Look at your logs to see if this is the case.
Resolve it yourself.
View the list of known issues to find a solution.
Add all basic troubleshooting steps to a post on the Cursor Forum.

qa_data.question: When using Ctrl + L, I submit my prompt, get a response, click Apply and the changes are not applied, what should I do?
answer_steps: When you submit a prompt using Ctrl + L, get a response, click Apply and the changes are not applied, it is likely a bug.
Here are some steps you can take.
View the list of known issues to find a solution.
Add all basic troubleshooting steps to a post on the Cursor Forum.

qa_data.question: What is Ctrl + L?
answer_steps: Ctrl + L is the keyboard shortcut that opens the Cursor Chat pane.

qa_data.question: What is Cursor?
answer_steps: Cursor is a fork of VS Code which has additional built in AI features.
This functionality is accessed via three user interfaces.
Ctrl + K, accessible via the Editor and Terminal, used for quick code and command generation.
Ctrl + L, accessible via the Side Bar, used for AI chat, where suggested edits can be applied to Editor code.
Ctrl + I, accessible via three views (Bar, Pane and Control Panel), used for multi-file creation and editing.

qa_data.question: Where is the Cursor Changelog?
answer_steps: You can view the Cursor Changelog at Cursor Changelog

qa_data.question: What is Accept All in Composer?
answer_steps: Clicking on Accept All in Composer adds all suggested changes to the relevant files.
Files must then be saved manually to save the changes.

qa_data.question: What is Reject All in Composer?
answer_steps: Clicking on Reject All in Composer rejects all suggested changes.

qa_data.question: Do the 2,000 completions in the hobby tier refresh each month?
answer_steps: Pending answer.

qa_data.question: Who is Anysphere?
answer_steps: Anysphere is the company that makes Cursor.

qa_data.question: What is Ctrl + I?
answer_steps: Ctrl + I is the keyboard shortcut that opens Composer.
Composer has three views - Bar, Pane and Control Panel.
It is used for multi-file creation and editing.

qa_data.question: How do I update Cursor?
answer_steps: Press Ctrl + Shift + P to open the Command Palette, then select Cursor: Attempt Update.
Be aware that Cursor does staged rollouts, so you may need to wait a while for the update to be available to you.
Typically, all users receive updates within 5 hours, however for larger updates it can take longer.

qa_data.question: Does Cursor support GitHub Codespaces?
answer_steps: Cursor does not support GitHub Codespaces yet.

qa_data.question: Does Cursor support the Remote SSH extension?
answer_steps: Cursor supports the use of the Remote SSH extension on Linux and Mac, but not on Windows yet.

qa_data.question: Does Cursor work behind a corporate proxy or VPN or Zscaler?
answer_steps: Cursor Tab and Ctrl + K use HTTP/2 by default, which allows Cursor to use less resources with lower latency. Some corporate proxies (e.g. Zscaler in certain configurations) block HTTP/2. To fix this, you can set 'cursor.general.disableHttp2': true in the VS Code settings (Ctrl + , and then search for http2).

qa_data.question: I have signed up to the Pro tier but I am still on the Hobby tier in the Cursor app, what should I do?
answer_steps: If you have signed up to the Pro tier but are still on the Hobby tier in Cursor, try logging out and logging back in again in the Cursor settings area.

qa_data.question: How do I uninstall Cursor?
answer_steps: To uninstall Cursor, follow the VS Code uninstall guide.
Replace all occurrences of VS Code or Code with Cursor, and .vscode with .cursor.

qa_data.question: When does my usage reset?
answer_steps: Pro users can click on Manage Subscription when logged in to their dashboard to view renewal date.
Hobby users can check when they first received an email from Cursor - usage will reset every month from that date.

qa_data.question: Where can I view the Cursor Privacy Policy?
answer_steps: You can view the Cursor Privacy Policy at https://www.cursor.com/privacy.

qa_data.question: Where can I view the Cursor Security policy?
answer_steps: You can view the Cursor Security policy at https://www.cursor.com/security.
